=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2019/05/24
Average Rating: 3.3
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ian Truitner'], 'Producers': ['Gabriella Cristiani', 'Matthew Gore', 'Hayley Helmreich', 'Jeffrey Magnussen', 'Chuck Parker', 'Merik Pelletier'], 'Starring': ['Sunny Mabrey', 'Lance Broadway', 'Michael Nouri'], 'Studio': ['High Octane Pictures', 'Thousand Mile Media']}
Review Text: Yes the blurb is technically correct, but the rescue crew is comprised of the latest model ART (artificial intelligence) and is more about their existence than a rescue in this B scifi drama. I gave it 4 stars for the attempt to present the dichotomy of human emotion and AI logic. The reason for all this is a tad contrived, but what the hey, it's a movie!
Review Title: Not what I expected, but not a bad treatise on the human condition.
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

Fury [Blu-ray]
Brad Pitt  (Actor),     Shia LaBeouf  (Actor),     David Ayer  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
['April, 1945. As the Allies make their final push in the European Theatre, a battle-hardened army sergeant named Wardaddy (Brad Pitt) commands a Sherman tank and her five-man crew on a deadly mission behind enemy lines. Outnumbered and outgunned, and with a rookie soldier thrust into their platoon, Wardaddy and his men face overwhelming odds in their heroic attempts to strike at the heart of Nazi Germany.']

Well acted, grim WWII action. Good job pointing out the inferiority of American armor and number of crews lost in the war, Rather orchestrated ending, but contains a nice surprise.
Grim but well done.

Salt (Deluxe Unrated Edition) [Blu-ray]
Angelina Jolie  (Actor),     Liev Schreiber  (Actor),     Philip Noyce  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
['Product Description', "Angelina Jolie stars in Columbia Pictures'", 'Salt', ', a contemporary espionage thriller. Before becoming a CIA officer, Evelyn Salt (Jolie) swore an oath to duty, honor, and country. She will prove loyal to these when a defector accuses her of being a Russian sleeper spy. Salt goes on the run, using all her skills and years of experience as a covert operative to elude capture, protect her husband, and stay one step ahead of her colleagues at the CIA.', 'Amazon.com', 'Angelina Jolie confirms her status as action-heroine supreme in the sinewy thriller', 'Salt', ". Evelyn Salt (Jolie) is a respected high-ranking CIA agent… until a defecting Russian operative declares that she's a Russian mole in deep cover, launching her on the most delicious chase sequence since the", 'Bourne', "movies. When the film's over you'll realize the motivations for much of what happened didn't make much sense, but while the movie's going on the pell-mell pace will brush such concerns from your mind. Director Phillip Noyce (", 'Patriot Games', ',', 'Dead Calm', ") has a gift for staging action sequences you can actually follow moment to moment, which is infinitely more engaging than frenzied editing that blurs everything into cattle-prod jolts--the movie's first third is top-notch orchestration. Jolie's star magnetism provides the cool, calm axis around which everything else revolves; the sturdy supporting performances of Liev Schreiber (", 'The Manchurian Candidate', ') and Chiwetel Ejiofor (', 'Inside Man', ',', 'Dirty Pretty Things', ') give enough heft to the plot to keep you from questioning anything.', 'Salt', 'is an old-fashioned entertainment, a skillfully made mechanism with enough grace notes to let it breathe and catch you by surprise.', '--Bret Fetzer']
{'Genre': 'Action, Drama, Thriller', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Angelina Jolie, Liev Schreiber, Philip Noyce', 'Language': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Runtime': '5 hours and 5 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.92 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'Salt Blu Ray', 'Director': 'Philip Noyce', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '5 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 6, 2011', 'Actors': 'Angelina Jolie, Liev Schreiber', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Number of discs': '1'}

Four Stars

It had everything going for it, hunky American who couldn't act, blonde girlfriend , and Asian temptress, all set in India. But as Mr. Cortez says elsewhere, the movie doesn't live up to it's title. Skip this one.
Don't waste your time
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Alan Overton'], 'Producers': ['Ted Leversuch', 'Phillip Watson'], 'Starring': ['Susan Baxter', 'Carol MacKenzie'], 'Studio': ['Sprocket Flicks']}
I've never seen the original, but seeing it was made in 62 I figured there wouldn't be much nudity anyway, but this was ridiculous. Viewed as half east coast travelogue and half proper boat etiquette it might have been OK, but...  The cheesy music played throughout ( think early Bewitched episodes), the ever present voice over ( think any travel film from the late 50's early 60's), the couple of nudists scenes that were shot from a distance and the whole early sixties fashion vibe make this version mostly unwatchable. But if you must, pop a beer, relax in your plastic webbed chaise lounge, and turn on the sunlamp.
Do not waste your time 2
{'Audio languages': ['한국어'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kwak Jae-yong'], 'Producers': ['Ho-Cheol Ahn', 'Young-jun Ji', 'Sang Han Shin'], 'Starring': ['Shin Min-ah', 'On Ju-wan', 'Yu Geon'], 'Studio': ['AsianCrush']}
The first two thirds of the movie is a rather slow romance between Shin Min-a and her hockey playing crush. Not much action except a couple of gang fights demonstrating the four martial arts types in the movie and some flashbacks on the Green Destiny sword, which Shin Min-a's mother wielded. The last third finally gets to the antagonist and improves a bit but not really enough to make the movie. Not a bad movie, but just not great. Also, for some reason the director(?) seemed to like the look of Shin Min-a's face when she puffed out her cheeks, and he has her do it way too much for my taste.
Tries hard but a trifle slow
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ryan Eslinger'], 'Producers': ['Steve Luna', 'Jamie Hoang'], 'Starring': ['Jaz Kemp', 'William Ferrer', 'Noah Cohen']}
I thought the premise was plausible and interesting, the acting was outstanding, and the movie moved right along. What else could you want? This is what Hollywood should be making instead of remakes and reboots.
Well made, interesting story
{'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Han Sang Hee'], 'Producers': ['Hirotsugu Asai', 'Shinji Fujiwara', 'Atsushi Hoshino', 'Atsushi Ichikawa', 'Yoshiharu Ishigaki', 'Sangwoo Kang', 'Mitsugu Matsuda', 'Yoshihisa Uragami'], 'Starring': ['Nanami Sakuraba', 'Byung Hun'], 'Studio': ['Jetsen']}
Set on the Island of Ishigaki in the Okinawa archipelago, the story concerns a heart recipient's discovery of whose heart beats within her chest. Part fable, part ghost story, let it lull you into a world where the impossible may be possible. Satisfying cast and beautiful scenery
Languid story of a girl's search for her destiny.

Yes the blurb is technically correct, but the rescue crew is comprised of the latest model ART (artificial intelligence) and is more about their existence than a rescue in this B scifi drama. I gave it 4 stars for the attempt to present the dichotomy of human emotion and AI logic. The reason for all this is a tad contrived, but what the hey, it's a movie!
Not what I expected, but not a bad treatise on the human condition.
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user maintains a robust interest in movies, particularly in Action & Adventure and historical war films centered on World War II, while continuing to appreciate K-pop performances and offbeat storytelling, showcasing their taste for diverse narratives.
- **Key Preferences:** They seek high-quality storytelling and acting, favoring authentic depictions of conflict. Their recent review highlighted a film that, despite being a B-level sci-fi drama, captivated them with its exploration of the human condition through the lens of artificial intelligence, reinforcing their preference for thought-provoking content.
- **Rating Trends:** With a critical yet open-minded approach, the user awarded a moderate rating to a romance film they found slow, while praising another work for its engaging narrative and performances. Their appreciation for films that present complex themes continues to shine through their ratings.
- **Director & Actor Appreciation:** They prefer renowned directors and actors, particularly in war dramas, while remaining receptive to unique stories that challenge conventions.
- **Content Preference:** They increasingly expect realistic portrayals that prioritize character development and emotional depth, voicing discontent with shallow narrative structures.
- **Media Format:** The user's strong preference for high-definition physical formats, like Blu-ray, underscores their commitment to coherent and engaging storytelling.

Overall, the user exemplifies a dedication to meaningful narratives and a discerning attitude towards films, while valuing works that provoke reflection on contemporary issues.
